task.title: Task Management
task.targetPlaceholder:
One target per line, supported formats:
• IP: 192.168.1.1
• CIDR: 192.168.1.0/24
• IP Range: 192.168.1.1-192.168.1.100
• Domain: example.com
task.subdomainEnumDesc: Subdomain scan uses Subfinder to enumerate subdomains for domain targets, discovered subdomains will be automatically added to scan targets
task.skipHostDiscoveryHint: Skip host discovery, scan ports directly
task.portIdentifyDesc: Port identify uses Nmap to detect service versions on open ports
task.confirmDeleteTask: Are you sure to delete this task?
task.batchDeleteSameWorkspace: Batch delete only works for tasks in the same workspace, please delete separately
task.confirmBatchDelete: Are you sure to delete the selected {count} tasks?
task.confirmRetry: Are you sure to retry this task? A new task will be created
task.confirmPause: Are you sure to pause this task?
task.confirmStop: Are you sure to stop this task?
task.multiScanHint: Multiple scan methods can be enabled simultaneously, results are automatically merged and deduplicated
task.dnsxBruteHint: Use Dnsx SDK for dictionary brute force
task.selectRecursiveDictFirst: Please select recursive dictionary first to enable recursive brute force
task.recursiveBruteHint: Continue brute forcing discovered subdomains to find deeper level subdomains
task.takeoverCheckHint: Check if subdomains have takeover risks (like GitHub Pages, Heroku, etc.)
task.canEnableDnsx: Dictionary selected, you can enable Dnsx dictionary brute force
task.sdkWappalyzer: Use SDK built-in Wappalyzer for fingerprinting
task.selectDictFirst: Please select dictionary first to enable dictionary brute force
task.wildcardDetectHint: Detect and filter wildcard domains to improve result accuracy
task.subdomainCrawlHint: Extract new subdomains from response body and JS files of discovered subdomains
task.activeScanHint: Access specific paths to identify applications (like /nacos/, /actuator, etc.), automatically enables custom fingerprint library when enabled
task.needFingerprintScan: Need to enable fingerprint scan to use web fingerprint auto match
task.multiScanHint: Multiple scan methods can be enabled simultaneously, results will be merged and deduplicated
task.selectDictFirst: Please select dictionary first to enable dictionary brute
task.dnsxBruteHint: Use Dnsx SDK for dictionary brute force
task.wildcardDetectHint: Detect and filter wildcard domains to improve accuracy
task.subdomainCrawlHint: Extract new subdomains from response body and JS files of discovered subdomains
task.takeoverCheckHint: Check if subdomain has takeover risk (e.g. GitHub Pages, Heroku)
task.canEnableDnsx: Dictionary selected, you can enable Dnsx dictionary brute
task.selectRecursiveDictFirst: Please select recursive dictionary first to enable recursive brute

task.activeScanHint: Access specific paths to identify applications (e.g. /nacos/, /actuator), auto enables custom fingerprint engine

poc.title: POC Management
poc.author: Author
poc.templateLibTip: Nuclei template library, supports importing templates from local nuclei-templates folder. Templates will be loaded from database based on task severity configuration during scanning.
poc.name: Name
poc.tagMappingTip: Configure mapping between Wappalyzer recognized application names and Nuclei tags. During scanning, corresponding POCs will be automatically selected based on identified applications.
poc.dirscanDictTip: Manage dictionary files for directory scanning, supports custom path lists. Select dictionaries to use for directory scanning when creating tasks.
poc.subdomainDictTip: Manage dictionary files for subdomain brute force, supports custom subdomain prefix lists. Select dictionaries to use for subdomain enumeration when creating tasks.
poc.pathListHint: One path per line, starting with /, supports # for comments
poc.wordListHint: One subdomain prefix per line, supports # for comments
poc.appNamePlaceholder: Wappalyzer recognized application name, e.g.: WordPress
poc.nucleiTagsPlaceholder: Enter Nuclei tags, separated by commas, e.g.: wordpress,wp-plugin,cve
poc.commonTags: Common tags: wordpress, apache, nginx, php, java, cve, rce, sqli, xss, lfi
poc.yamlHint: Paste or edit Nuclei YAML template, fields below will be auto-parsed from YAML
poc.parseResult: Parse Result (auto-extracted from YAML, can be modified)
poc.tagsParsed: Parsed from YAML info.tags, separated by commas
poc.vulnDescPlaceholder:
Describe the vulnerability to detect, e.g.:
• Detect SQL injection vulnerability at /api/search with parameter keyword
• Detect Apache Tomcat CVE-2020-1938 AJP file read vulnerability
• Detect unauthorized access at /admin
poc.referencePlaceholder: Optional: Provide vulnerability reference links, PoC code snippets, etc.
poc.folderSelectHint: Select folder containing Nuclei YAML templates, will auto-scan all .yaml/.yml files
poc.xrayPasteHint: Paste XRAY YAML POC content, will auto-convert to Nuclei format, supports importing multiple POCs (separated by ---)
poc.uploadHint: Drag files here, or click to upload
poc.uploadTip: Supports .yaml / .yml files, can select multiple files
poc.xrayConvertNote: (XRAY format will be auto-converted to Nuclei format)
poc.supportsTxtFile: Supports .txt file, one URL per line
poc.targetUrlsPlaceholder:
Enter target URLs, one per line, e.g.:
https://example1.com
https://example2.com
https://example3.com
poc.onlyTxtFile: Only supports .txt file, one URL per line
poc.scanAssetsTip: Click "Start Scan" to scan all HTTP assets in current workspace with this POC
poc.scanAssetsTipDetail: Scan task will execute asynchronously, discovered vulnerabilities will be shown in "Vulnerability Management" page
poc.confirmClearTemplates: Are you sure to clear all Nuclei default templates? This action cannot be undone!
poc.confirmDeleteMapping: Are you sure to delete this mapping?
poc.confirmDeletePoc: Are you sure to delete this POC?
poc.confirmDeleteDict: Are you sure to delete dictionary "{name}"?
poc.confirmClearCustomDict: Are you sure to clear all custom dictionaries? Built-in dictionaries will not be deleted.
poc.confirmClearPoc: Are you sure to clear all custom POCs? {count} POCs will be deleted, this action cannot be undone!
poc.validateTimeout: Validation timeout, please check Worker status
poc.pleaseSelectTemplates: Please select templates to validate first
poc.submittingBatchTask: Submitting batch validation task, {templates} templates × {urls} targets = {total} tasks...
poc.pleaseEnterVulnDesc: Please enter vulnerability description or CVE ID
poc.pleaseConfigAiService: Please configure AI service address first
poc.invalidNucleiFormat: AI returned content is not valid Nuclei POC format
poc.pocGenerateSuccess: POC generated successfully, please review and save
poc.cannotConnectAi: Cannot connect to AI service, please ensure service is running
poc.batchScanTaskCreated: Batch scan task created, targets: {count} assets
poc.scanComplete: Scan complete, scanned {total} assets, found {vulns} vulnerabilities

fingerprint.title: Fingerprint Management
fingerprint.builtinTip: Wappalyzer built-in fingerprints synced to database, you can edit enable/disable status. Supports uploading Wappalyzer technologies.json format files.
fingerprint.activeTip: Active scan fingerprints identify applications by accessing specific paths.
fingerprint.activeRelatedTip: Related rules: Active fingerprints automatically associate with passive fingerprints of the same name. During scanning, active paths are probed first, then passive fingerprint rules match the response content.
fingerprint.serviceMappingTip: Configure mapping between Service names identified by port scanning and HTTP/non-HTTP services. Fingerprint identification will determine whether to perform HTTP probing on the port based on this configuration.
fingerprint.serviceMappingNote: Note: The latest configuration is fetched from the database before each scan, changes take effect immediately.
fingerprint.httpServiceImportTip: Support importing service mapping and port mapping configuration in txt format. Duplicates will be automatically skipped during import.
fingerprint.httpServiceImportPlaceholder:
Paste configuration content or select file to upload...

Format example:
[http_ports]
80
8080

[https_ports]
443

[service_mapping]
http=http # HTTP service
ssh=non_http # SSH service
fingerprint.portConfigTip: Configure Web ports and non-Web ports lists. When port scanning cannot identify the service name, it will determine whether to perform fingerprint scanning based on the port number.
fingerprint.portConfigNote: Note: The latest configuration is fetched from the database before each scan, changes take effect immediately.
fingerprint.httpPortsPlaceholder: Enter HTTP ports, separated by comma, space or newline, e.g.: 80, 8080, 8000
fingerprint.httpsPortsPlaceholder: Enter HTTPS ports, separated by comma, space or newline, e.g.: 443, 8443
fingerprint.nonWebPorts: Non-Web Ports (explicitly excluded, no fingerprint scanning)
fingerprint.nonHttpPortsPlaceholder: Enter non-Web ports, separated by comma, space or newline, e.g.: 22, 135, 445, 3306
fingerprint.matchLogicTip: Different types are AND relationship, multiple rules within the same type are OR relationship
fingerprint.matchLogicExample: Example: When both Headers and HTML rules are configured, both need to match; but when HTML has multiple regexes, only one needs to match
fingerprint.noRules: This fingerprint has no match rules configured
fingerprint.andLogic: AND logic, all conditions must be met
fingerprint.orLogic: OR logic, any condition can be met
fingerprint.passiveTip: Passive fingerprints identify applications by analyzing HTTP response content
fingerprint.activeTip: Active fingerprints identify applications by accessing specific paths
fingerprint.wappalyzerFormatTip: Use Wappalyzer standard format, supports headers, cookies, html, scripts and other fields
fingerprint.simplifiedFormatTip: Use simplified syntax, e.g.: body="keyword" && title="title"
fingerprint.simplifiedRulePlaceholder: Enter simplified rule, e.g.: body="Nacos" || title="Nacos"
fingerprint.supportMultiFormat: Supports multiple fingerprint formats, can upload multiple files
fingerprint.arlFormatPlaceholder:
Paste ARL format fingerprints, one per line, format:
app_name||rule
Example:
Nacos||body="Nacos"
Spring Boot||header="X-Application-Context"
fingerprint.uploadHint: Drag files here, or click to upload
fingerprint.wappalyzerDataTip: Get fingerprints_data.json file from wappalyzergo project
fingerprint.targetUrlsPlaceholder: Enter target URLs, one per line
fingerprint.serviceNamePlaceholder: Enter service name, e.g.: http, https, ssl/http
fingerprint.activeYamlFormat: Supports YAML format active fingerprint configuration
fingerprint.confirmDelete: Are you sure to delete this fingerprint?
fingerprint.confirmClear: Are you sure to clear all custom fingerprints?
fingerprint.confirmClearActive: Are you sure to clear all active scan fingerprints?

blacklist.configDesc: Configure global blacklist rules, matching assets will be automatically excluded during scanning
blacklist.rulesApplyDesc: These rules will apply to all target scan tasks. To configure blacklist for specific targets, go to Target → Settings.
blacklist.globalRulesHint: Global rules apply to all targets. Target-level rules can be configured in Target → Settings.
blacklist.rulesPlaceholder:
One rule per line, supported formats:
*.gov          - Match all .gov domains
*.edu          - Match all .edu domains
*.mil          - Match all .mil domains
10.0.0.0/8     - Match 10.x.x.x network
172.16.0.0/12  - Match 172.16-31.x.x network
192.168.0.0/16 - Match 192.168.x.x network
127.0.0.1      - Match single IP
*cdn*          - Match domains containing cdn keyword

# Lines starting with # are comments

worker.title: Worker Management
worker.confirmRestart: Are you sure to restart this Worker?
worker.confirmDelete: Are you sure to delete this Worker? This will stop the Worker and clear its data
worker.concurrencyNote: Decreasing concurrency takes effect immediately; increasing requires Worker restart
worker.dockerDeployNote: Deploy Worker probe with Docker in one click, no need to worry about system environment compatibility
worker.noLogsYet: No logs yet, Worker pushes logs to server via WebSocket

settings.title: System Settings
settings.onlineApiTip: Configure online search API keys for asset search on platforms like Fofa, Hunter, Quake
settings.subfinderTip: Subfinder is used for subdomain enumeration. Configure API keys to get results from more data sources. Click data source name to get API key from official website
settings.notifyTip: Configure task completion notifications. Supports Email, Feishu, DingTalk, WeCom, Slack, Discord, Telegram, Teams, Gotify, Webhook. High-risk filter settings are in the "High Risk Filter" menu.
settings.templatePlaceholder: Leave empty to use default template. Supports variables {{.TaskName}}, {{.Status}}, {{.AssetCount}}, {{.VulCount}}, {{.Duration}}
settings.testSuccess: Test successful, please check if you received the notification
settings.confirmDeleteNotify: Are you sure to delete this notification config?

highRiskFilter.alertDescription: Configure high-risk filter rules. Notifications will only be sent when scan results contain the configured high-risk items. All notifications are sent by default when not configured.
highRiskFilter.enableFilterHint: All notifications when disabled, only notify when high-risk items detected when enabled
highRiskFilter.fingerprintPlaceholder: Select from existing fingerprints or enter custom name
highRiskFilter.fingerprintHint: Select from scanned fingerprints or enter custom fingerprint name
highRiskFilter.portPlaceholder: Select from existing ports or enter custom port
highRiskFilter.portHint: Select from scanned ports or enter custom port number
highRiskFilter.severityHint: Select vulnerability severity levels that trigger notifications
